snippet: The move could be a sign that the marketplace is becoming resistant to the unfettered increase in the prices of cancer drugs over the last decade.
abstract: Drug maker Sanofi announces that it will effectively cut in half the price of its new colon cancer drug Zaltrap after Memorial Sloan-Kettering Cancer Center in New York announced that it would not use the drug due to expense.
lead_paragraph: The move could be a sign that the marketplace is becoming resistant to the unfettered increase in the prices of cancer drugs over the last decade.

headline.seo: Sanofi Halves Price of Drug After Sloan-Kettering Balks at Paying It
headline.main: Sanofi Halves Price of Cancer Drug Zaltrap After Sloan-Kettering Rejection
headline.print_headline: Sanofi Halves Price of Cancer Drug Zaltrap After Sloan-Kettering Rejection
